SEARCH

Class Vector

java.lang.Object
Vector
public class Vector extends Object
The vector class is a representation of a 3D math vector

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description

    VERSOR_X

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Vector()
    Constructs a vector and sets its all coordinates to 0.
    Vector(double x)
    Constructs a vector and sets its x-coordinate to the given number, and y and z coordinates to 0.
    Vector(double x, double y)
    Constructs a vector and sets the x and y coordinates to the given numbers, and z coordinate to 0.
    Vector(double x, double y, double z)
    Constructs a vector and sets the x, y and z coordinates to the given numbers.
    Vector(Vector other)
    Copy constructor creates a vector with the other's vector coordinates.

      public double length()
      Returns the Euclidean norm (length) of this vector, computed as the square root of the sum of the squares of its coordinates.
      Returns:
      length of this vector.

    • dotProduct

      public static double dotProduct(Vector v1, Vector v2)
      Computes the dot product of two vectors. The dot product is calculated as the sum of the products of corresponding coordinates.
      Parameters:
      v1 - The first vector
      v2 - The second vector
      Returns:
      The dot product of the two vectors

    • crossProduct

      public static Vector crossProduct(Vector v1, Vector v2)
      Computes the cross product of two vectors. The cross product is a vector perpendicular to the plane formed by the two input vectors.
      Parameters:
      v1 - The first vector
      v2 - The second vector
      Returns:
      The cross product vector

    • vectorOf

      public static Vector vectorOf(double x, double y, double z)
      Constructs a vector from the given coordinates.
      Parameters:
      x - x-coordinate value
      y - y-coordinate value
      z - z-coordinate value
      Returns:
      vector created from the given coordinates.

    • normalize

      public void normalize()
      Normalizes the vector, transforming it into a unit vector. A unit vector has a length of 1, while preserving its original direction.

    • opposite

      public void opposite()
      Negates the vector, changing the direction of each of its coordinates.
